image.altText: Leanne wears a winter coat and smiles standing outside.

props.synopsis: ACT Opposition Leader Leanne Castley says no "formal complaints" have been lodged within the Liberal team following MLA Peter Cain's resignation from her shadow cabinet over leadership concerns.

title.children: Castley says no warning before resignation, Cain insists he did

image.altText: Two deep green marajuana leaf-shaped gummy lollies on a wire rack beside a white ruler, showing them to be roughly 4cm each.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old former Vietnamese student who sold cannabis gummies to Canberra schoolchildren and traded in illegal vapes, is jailed by the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: 'Jelly wobbles': Man jailed for selling cannabis gummies to children

image.altText: An exterior shot of an ANU building.

props.synopsis: Independent ACT senator David Pocock wrote to Jason Clare on June 16 to raise concerns about governance and financial management at the ANU, which is pursuing a controversial restructure to save $250 million by 2026.

title.children: Federal education minister refers concerns about ANU to regulator

image.altText: A young man wearing a green Canberra Raiders jersey stands on a football field looking serious with on e hand on his hip.

props.synopsis: The NRL's most demonstratively passionate and self-proclaimed "emotional" coach, Ricky Stuart, will have an extra reason to reach for the tissues this week, as he watches his son make his first-grade debut.

title.children: 'He's earned his spot': Ricky Stuart's son to debut for the Raiders

image.altText: Jason Haines, St John's Care

props.synopsis: A Canberra emergency food relief charity says scammers impersonated it on social media and stole people's Centrelink payments after offering interest free loans.

title.children: Community's poorest lose MyGov payments in 'ingenious' charity scam

image.altText: A man with short dark hair in a navy suit and tie looks down at a smartphone as he walks out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court hears a mother was in disbelief to find out her 11-year-old daughter was allegedly sexually assaulted by a man she met on a dating app.

title.children: Mother shocked by 11yo's alleged assault by man she met on dating app

image.altText: Trump sits with his lips pursed, arms folded.

props.synopsis: With Donald Trump delaying his decision on possible US military action in the Middle East, what is he playing at?

title.children: Donald Trump needs to make a huge decision. Why delay it two weeks?

props.synopsis: Over the AFLW off-season, Hawthorn's Tilly Lucas-Rodd underwent top surgery, a gender-affirming procedure that involves the removal of breast tissue in essentially a double mastectomy.

title.children: 'Huge dysphoria': First current AFLW player undergoes top surgery

image.altText: Jarome Luai of the Tigers holding the ball in two hands, running across field

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers halfback Jarome Luai will play tonight after being part of a gruelling State of Origin two nights ago, while his NSW teammate Hudson Young will line up for the Canberra Raiders. Follow live.

title.children: Origin stars complete 48-hour turnaround to play for Tigers and Raiders

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: TEAM LISTS: Jarome Luai to start for Wests Tigers
'He's earned his spot': Ricky Stuart's son to debut for the Raiders
Welcome to ABC Sport's NRL live blog

image.altText: GettyImages-2172532068

props.synopsis: Brisbane travels to Geelong, hoping to end a 22-year wait for a win at Kardinia Park against the Cats with the Lions' top-four spot on the line, as Patrick Dangerfield plays game 350. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: High-flying Cats host Lions side trying to break two-decade hoodoo

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We are underway at Kardinia Park

image.altText: Five empty chairs at NSW Parliament's Macquarie Room parliamentary inquiry into the alleged Dural caravan plot

props.synopsis: The committee will go to the president of the Legislative Council Ben Franklin to ask if he could request arrest warrants in the NSW Supreme Court.

title.children: Five NSW government staffers risk arrest over inquiry no-show

image.altText: A hornbill looks through the bars of a cage. Others are visible in the background.

props.synopsis: The exotic pet industry is booming, fuelled by global demand for rare parrots, reptiles and other wild creatures — but in Solomon Islands, one of the Pacific's most active wildlife trading hubs, it is under growing scrutiny.

title.children: Inside the Pacific's largest exotic animal export industry

image.altText: A man and woman slumping on their seats inside an airport

props.synopsis: Australians who were in Bali during a 2017 volcano eruption emphasise the importance of taking out travel insurance, following news of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki's eruption.

title.children: Australians stranded in Bali last time urge others not to repeat their mistake

image.altText: Daryl McGuire in suit walks outside of court

props.synopsis: Prosecutors argued Daryl Maguire engaged in a "money making exercise" when he allegedly discussed a commission with a local councillor over a multimillion-dollar property deal.

title.children: Former Wagga Wagga MP found guilty of giving misleading evidence at ICAC

image.altText: Close-up of three opaque ice balls on a ledge

props.synopsis: Temperatures have been plummeting in large parts of the country as we are closing in on the shortest day of the year. But during the depths of winter, which town holds bragging rights as the coldest in the country?

title.children: Australia's coldest town revealed as mercury drops sub zero for some

image.altText: The sun setting over parramatta

props.synopsis: The winter solstice has the least amount of incoming heat directly from sunlight. However, for nearly the whole of Australia, the coldest weather does not arrive when the days are shortest.

title.children: Seasonal lag delays coldest weather for weeks after winter solstice

image.altText: Renders of twin towers on the Gold Coast

props.synopsis: If the project is built, many of the 101-storey tower's luxury penthouses will look down on the spire of the Q1 building in nearby Surfers Paradise.

title.children: Developers lodge plans for Australia's tallest building on Gold Coast

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a group of teenage school girls on their phones, wearing formal school uniforms.

props.synopsis: A company contracted by the government to assess technologies for verifying the ages of online users says it can be done privately, robustly and effectively.

title.children: Trial finds age assurance can be done, as social media ban deadline looms

image.altText: A crash site showing strewn plane debris on country terrain.

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) recently found that a 2023 triple-fatal crash near Cloncurry was "entirely preventable" after the pilot likely suffered hypoxia caused by a well-known, long-standing defect. So what is hypoxia and how common is it on planes?

title.children: What is hypoxia and why is it so dangerous on planes?

image.altText: An X-ray of a person's hips.

props.synopsis: A study that claims the popular OsteoStrong program can help strengthen bones in post-menopausal women is "misleading", and "should never have been published", say bone health researchers.

title.children: Study supporting 10-minute 'bone-strengthening' exercise called into question

image.altText: Indian Pacers player Tyrese Haliburton hugs former Pacers player Reggie Miller while surrounded by cameras at the NBA Finals.

props.synopsis: The NBA Finals are going to a deciding Game 7 for the first time in almost a decade after a dominant win by the Pacers over Oklahoma City Thunder tied the series at 3-3.

title.children: Pacers force first NBA Finals Game 7 since famous 2016 decider

image.altText: family sit in the backyard on chairs and blankets with drinks and kids on swings

props.synopsis: As more Australians rely on family to enter the housing market, the backyard of mum and dad is becoming an appealing option.

title.children: The backyard of mum and dad is a new way to enter the housing market

image.altText: Alex Chidiac claps her hands after the Matildas played England in the FIFA Women's World Cup semifinal.

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro has named a 33-player squad for upcoming friendlies with Slovenia and Panama, featuring a mix of old and new faces.

title.children: Matildas unveil new-look squad for Slovenia and Panama clashes

image.altText: A red and white plane takes off into the sky with lights in the distance

props.synopsis: India's aviation regulator had warned the airline about a number of safety issues involving other planes in its fleet before last week's fatal crash.

title.children: Air India warned about fleet's safety issues before fatal Ahmedabad crash

image.altText: A lady in a green jacket speaks to a crowd

props.synopsis: The man had accused Nationals MP Anne Webster and her husband of corruption and paedophilia, which a magistrate described as "conspiracy theory allegations".

title.children: Federal MP drops safety order request against One Nation supporter

image.altText: Sussan Ley press conference smile

props.synopsis: To the extent anyone is paying attention, Sussan Ley has made a better start than many, including some Liberals, had expected.

title.children: Sussan Ley isn't dealing with the media like Peter Dutton did

image.altText: A piece of slow-cooked lamb in a pot alongside lemon, fennel, potatoes and juices, topped with fresh green herbs.

props.synopsis: From lamb and pork to a vegetarian option, we're dishing up the best tips and tricks for warming winter roasts.

title.children: Four cooks share their secrets to the perfect winter roast

image.altText: Police officers and vehicles behind tall palms on a hot-looking street.

props.synopsis: Police vow to "leave no stone unturned" in their search for answers after a woman's body was found on a Townsville street.

title.children: Police declare crime scene after woman's body found on busy street

image.altText: Lauren smiles as she looks to the camera in a headshot wearing a white top, with her short dark hair down.

props.synopsis: For many people, becoming a bestselling author with a TV adaptation in the works is little more than a pipedream. For Lauren, it became reality by the time she turned 22.

title.children: Lauren googled 'how to self-publish a book'. Months later, she was a bestseller

image.altText: South Australia's health minster talking to the mother of a child with ADHD

props.synopsis: Amid reports of patients waiting months and paying thousands of dollars for an ADHD diagnosis, the state government will allow GPs to diagnose the disorder in an effort to speed up the process.

title.children: South Australian GPs to diagnose ADHD in bid to cut patient wait times

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Former leader John Pesutto has expressed his gratitude to the Victorian Liberal Party after its administrative committee voted to lend him $1.55 million to pay his legal costs to MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: 'Grateful and humbled': Liberals save John Pesutto from bankruptcy

image.altText: Flames rise into the air following an explosion at nighttime

props.synopsis: The company said the explosion was due to a "major anomaly", and said all personnel were safe.

title.children: SpaceX Starship rocket explodes in latest setback to Musk's Mars mission
